title: Teen's severed head hurled from 12th floor flat in front of horrified children

Children watched in horror as a teen's body parts - including her severed head - were hurled from the 12th floor of a block of flats after she was murdered.

The youngsters were playing outside when blood-stained clothes were first thrown from a balcony on one of the upper floors.

They looked on as the woman's dismembered body parts, including her head, were then tossed from a flat in the Siberian city of Chita in south-eastern Russia.

The 19-year-old victim has been named only as Elizaveta, who worked at a strip club, and the murder suspect, who has been arrested, was her boyfriend, according to local media reports.

(Image: east2west news)

A 38-year-old man was detained when police smashed down the door of his rented apartment.

Witness Igor Shalaev, 15, said: “It was me and my friends who found the body parts. It was very scary.

“First the clothes were thrown out all covered in blood and then the head. Very scary.”

(Image: east2west news)

Some human remains landed on the roof covering the 15-storey apartment block doorway.

Some reports said that the woman was the man’s girlfriend.

She is known to have worked at strip club called Zazhigalka, part of a chain all around the country.

(Image: east2west news)

Police said a murder probe had been launched.

A spokesperon said: “The dead woman has been identified as a 19-year-old citizen of Chita.

“The man, born in 1981, who rented an apartment in the same block, has been detained and brought to investigators for interrogation."

(Image: east2west news)

Local residents were also being questioned over the incident.

“Investigators are inspecting the scene and interrogating residents of the apartment block with the participation of forensic investigators,” said the Russian Investigative Committee.

“Eyewitnesses to the crime have been established.”

(Image: east2west news)

A friend of the dead woman posted an appeal to help with money for her funeral.

“She was raised in an orphanage, and lived with her grandmother,” said the friend.

“There is no money for her funeral.”

Chita is a city with a population of 330,000 in eastern Siberia, close to the Russian border with Mongolia.
